alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 10:38AM EDT until April 08 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in New Jersey... South Branch Raritan River At Stanton affecting Somerset and Hunterdon Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in New Jersey... North Branch Raritan River At Raritan affecting Somerset County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Branch Raritan River At Stanton. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor low land flooding downstream of gauge. At 8.0 feet, Right bank and approach to bridge is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EDT Friday was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 3.9 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.3 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date South Branch Rar Stanton 8.0 8.3 Fri 10 a 5.6 4.4 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1145 AM EDT.
